result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Copus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark Copus is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark Copus was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Mark Copus was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each count concur. Count 3 held open. If def successfully completes probation, State has no objection to dismissal of count 3.

miscConds.notes: $243 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
$243 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 4.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: on petition for early discharge from probation SS973.09(3)(d). Granted.

Defendant appeared.  Tim Helmberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation agent Laura Worthman appeared by phone.
Court to dismiss open count 3, and signs order for early discharge of probation.
Probation Agent recommending early discharge from probation pursuant to Sec. 973.09(3)(d) Wis. Stats.
Probation review hearing on December 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND - CONDITIONS MODIFIED
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant may possess a bow and arrow for WI bow hunting seasons 2015 and 2016 years only, and subject to all WI Statutes and Administrative Regulations/Codes relative to bow hunting during WI bow hunting seasons.  The "no dangerous weapons" condition of bond is not modified in any way other than the one explicit way set forth above.  
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jason E., Jordan R., Devin E. or Matthew K.
- Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not possess drug paraphernalia.

Defendant appeared.  Joseph E. Mimier appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation agent Laura Worthaman appeared by phone

Court grants travel request as outlined in defendant's written request. Court orders no fewer than 3 random UAs to be completed between today and February, continued compliance with probation, UA to be completed 48hrs of return from trip.
Condition of bond amended, defendant may possess a bow and arrow for WI bow hunting season 2015 and 2016 years only, subject to the same terms in the 12-5-14 signature bond. All other conditions reamin in effect, defendant may not possess any other dangerous weapons.
